intro: Primula veris subsp. officinalis, commonly known as the common cowslip, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and oval, dark green leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along streambanks. The flowers are not only ornamental but also have historical uses in herbal medicine.
